properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 6 at 10:41AM EST by NWS Peachtree City GA
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a Flood
Warning for the following rivers in Georgia...

Euharlee Creek near Rockmart affecting Polk County


.Recent heavy rainfall has caused significant runoff into streams and
rivers which will cause flooding in some areas.

The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a
* Flood Warning for
The Euharlee Creek near Rockmart.
* From this morning until further notice.
* At 10 AM Thursday the stage was 8.9 feet...and rising.
* Flood stage is 9 feet.
* At 9 feet...Minor flooding begins along the creek upstream and
downstream from the gage on Church Street. Portions of the Wayside
Park will have water a foot or two deep. Sections of the sidewalk
along Water Street will begin to flood. The water reaches the
bottom of The Silver Comet Trail foot bridge just downstream from
West Elm Street.
properties.instruction:
All persons with interests along the river should monitor the latest
forecasts...and be prepared to take necessary precautions to protect
life and property.

The latest stage data was furnished in cooperation with the United
States Geological Survey.
